snippet: Dealers are now traveling to art fairs from Miami to Hong Kong to Basel to São Paulo, but this globalization of the market is easier for galleries with deep pockets — smaller ones are at a disadvantage.
abstract: Globalization in art world is forcing dealers out of galleries in New York and London, and into worldwide fairs from Miami to Hong Kong to Basel to Sao Paulo; increased demand for dealers to travel is easier for galleries with deep pockets, leaving smaller players at disadvantage, resulting in significant wave of changes in market.
lead_paragraph: Dealers are now traveling to art fairs from Miami to Hong Kong to Basel to São Paulo, but this globalization of the market is easier for galleries with deep pockets — smaller ones are at a disadvantage.

headline.main: For Art Dealers, a New Life on the Fair Circuit
